citeinfo.origin: Department of the Interior, National Park Service, Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park
citeinfo.title: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park Vegetation Mapping Project - Park Boundary

descript.abstract: This administrative boundary for Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park (BLCA), Colorado contains 6 polygons showing National Park Service (NPS) lands, and private lands (3 parcels with conservation easements held by NPS with no public access, and 1 parcel without a conservation easement) that lie within the Park boundary outline.
descript.purpose: To show the Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park boundary. The intended use of all data in the park's GIS libraries is to support diverse park activities including planning, management, maintenance, research, and interpretation.
descript.supplinf: The Black Canyon of the Gunnison's unique and spectacular landscape was formed slowly by the action of water and rock scouring down through hard Proterozoic crystalline rock. No other canyon in North America combines the narrow opening, sheer walls, and startling depths offered by the Black Canyon of the Gunnison.

idinfo.useconst: This dataset should only be used for general reference information purposes. Do not use for legal land ownership determinations.

citeinfo.origin: BLCA/CURE GIS Staff, B. Vlahos - BLM Montrose, M. Reynolds - NPS
citeinfo.title: Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park boundary (1999)
citeinfo.othercit: New park boundary created by 1999 legislation changing status from National Monument to a National Park

attracc.attraccr: The attribute accuracy is tested by manually comparing hard copy plots of the digital data with the source materials. When attributes cannot be visually verified on plots they are interactively queried and verified on screen.

dataqual.logic: ARC/INFO software is used to create and maintain topological relationships between features. There are no duplicate features, but coincident lines are maintained between data layers where appropriate. Polygonal features begin and end at the same point, contain no overshoots or undershoots, and contain a single label.

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal positional accuracy is tested by visual comparison of hard copy check plots to the source materials and verifying the location of the data on screen relative to other data layers in the same geographic area.

citeinfo.origin: National Park Service, Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park/Curecanti National Recreation Area - GIS Staff
citeinfo.title: BLCA legislation coverage
citeinfo.othercit: Park boundary of Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park created after 1999 legislation changing the status from a National Monument to a National Park.

srcinfo.srccontr: 1999 park boundary which provide spatial and attribute information.

citeinfo.origin: Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Montrose, CO - GIS Staff
citeinfo.title: BLM Land Status
citeinfo.othercit: Land Status for BLM Southwest Center, Colorado. Originally digitized in 1985 and updated as needed. GIS file named mdo_lst (land status for the Montrose District Office).

srcinfo.srccontr: The land status coverage was utilized for spatial reference.

citeinfo.origin: Bureau of Land Management (BLM), Montrose, CO - GIS Staff
citeinfo.title: Geographic Coordinate Database (GCDB) Montrose District Office dataset
citeinfo.othercit: The file that was used was the BLM Montrose Office GIS dataset called mdo_gcdb (GCDB data which covered the Montrose District only).

srcinfo.srccontr: The 1999 legislation boundary coverage arc vertices were adjusted to the arcs of the GCDB data in those areas where they were slightly off of the GCDB lines.

citeinfo.origin: National Park Service, Black Canyon of the Gunnison National Park/Curecanti National Recreation Area - GIS Staff
citeinfo.title: Scenic easements

srcinfo.srccontr: Scenic easement arcs were appended to the BLCA boundary. Attribute data were verified against the original scenic easement data.

procstep.procdesc: The 1999 legislation boundary coverage arc vertices were adjusted to the arcs of the GCDB data (considered to be the most accurate data, representing 1/16th of a section) in those areas where they were slightly off of the GCDB lines. The boundary coverage was then built for topology in ArcEdit with the "build" command, and saved. The land status coverage was utilized for spatial reference. Scenic easement arcs were appended to the BLCA boundary with ArcEdit commands "Sel" and "Put". Corresponding attribute data were then filled in manually and verified against the original scenic easement data. The new BLCA boundary coverage was then built in ArcEdit and saved. Acres were then recalculated.

distinfo.distliab:
The U.S. Geological Survey and the National Park Service shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein. These data and related graphics (if available) are not legal documents and are not intended to be used as such.
The information contained in these data is dynamic and may change over time. The data are not better than the original sources from which they were derived. It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. Any related graphics (if available) are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not approriate to use the related graphics as data.
The U.S. Geological Survey and the National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an U.S. Geological Survey and National Park Service servers and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. Mention of trade names or commercial products in this metadata report does not constitute endorsement or recommendation for use by the U. S. Department of the Interior, U. S. Geological Survey and National Park Service.
